meanings.definition: Material or substance used to prevent heat, sound, or electricity from passing through
meanings.sent1: The thick insulation in the walls kept the house warm during the winter.
meanings.sent2: The insulation in the attic helps to regulate the temperature inside the building.
meanings.sent3: The insulation in the fridge was so good that even the ice cream stayed frozen solid.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words acted as insulation against the harsh criticism from others.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's suit had special insulation to protect them from extreme temperatures in space.

meanings.definition: The act of insulating or the state of being insulated
meanings.sent1: The insulation of the wires prevented any electrical accidents in the house.
meanings.sent2: Proper insulation of the pipes helped to prevent them from freezing in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The insulation of the team from the coach's anger was short-lived.
meanings.sent4: The insulation of the students from distractions led to better focus in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The insulation of the house from noise pollution made it a peaceful retreat.
